result.execSummary:
The defendant Jacob T Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: 15CF46 or any other sentence

miscConds.notes: Total costs and restitution to be paid while on probation. If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, in addition to all other enforcement sanctions available to the court, a civil judgment enforceable by all creditors' remedies shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.

Defendant to pay supervision fees.
Defendant must submit DNA sample within 30 days.
Court orders absolute sobriety.  No possession/consumption of any intoxicants.  
Defendant to submit to random testing.
Defendant to obtain book Unbroken by Laura Hillenbrand. After reading the book, defendant is to answer each of the questions that are located at the back of the book. Defendant to submit ONLY once a month and ONLY one question per month, answering how this will help him and his rehabilitative needs.

The restitution amount listed reflects an additional Administrative Cost of 10% of the amount of restitution pursuant to Section 973.06(1)(g).  The 5% Restitution Surcharge is equal to 5% of the total of the restitution, costs, attorney fees, and fines, pursuant to Section 973.20(11)(a).

records.addlTxt: Defendant Jacob T Anderson in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Shannon M. Whitworth appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea questionnaire filed. Defendant pleading guilty. Court examines defendant, accepts plea and finds defendant guilty. State confirms victim rights have been complied with. State makes recommendation. Counsel addresses court. Defendant addresses court. Court renders sentence.

Defendant Jacob T Anderson in court with attorney Rachel Marie Alme-Boaz.  Defendant in custody. Jeffrey A Sisley appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Counsel waives time limits and requests preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 4, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jacob T Anderson appearing by video conferencing from the Ozaukee county Jail and with attorney Jamie Marie Mcclendon.  Defendant in custody. State requesting $2500 cash bail w/conditions.  Court finds good cause to extend time limits for holding of the prelim hrg.  Status hearing scheduled for March 8, 2016 at 10:00 am.
